items.name: Plaza De Armas de Lima
items.address: Jirón de la Unión, Cercado de Lima, Lima 15001, Peru
items.description: The historic heart of Lima, surrounded by the Government Palace, Cathedral, and Archbishop's Palace. A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the starting point for exploring the city's colonial past.

items.name: Museo Larco
items.address: Av. Simón Bolívar 1515, Pueblo Libre, Lima 15084, Peru
items.description: A world-renowned museum showcasing pre-Columbian art, pottery, and gold and silver treasures. Its beautiful 18th-century mansion and lush gardens offer a unique cultural experience.

items.name: Malecón De Miraflores
items.address: Malecón de la Reserva, Miraflores, Lima 15074, Peru
items.description: A scenic clifftop promenade with breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean, perfect for walking, cycling, or paragliding. Home to parks, sculptures, and romantic sunset spots.

items.name: Huaca Pucllana
items.address: Calle General Borgoño cuadra 8, Miraflores, Lima 15074, Peru
items.description: An ancient adobe pyramid built by the Lima culture around 500 AD. Offers guided tours and a renowned restaurant overlooking the archaeological site.

items.name: Parque Kennedy
items.description: A lively urban park surrounded by cafes, shops, and artisan markets. Known for its resident cats and frequent cultural events, it's a favorite gathering spot for locals and tourists.

items.name: Parque de la Reserva – Magic Water Circuit
items.address: Jr. Madre de Dios S/N, Cercado de Lima, Lima 15046, Peru
items.description: A dazzling nighttime attraction featuring a series of illuminated fountains with choreographed water, light, and music shows.

items.name: Barranco District
items.description: Lima’s bohemian neighborhood filled with colorful murals, art galleries, bars, and cafes. Home to the iconic Puente de los Suspiros and a vibrant nightlife scene.

items.name: Parque El Olivar
items.address: Calle La Republica 455, San Isidro, Lima 15073, Peru
items.description: A peaceful park filled with centuries-old olive trees, historic homes, and charming walking paths. A green oasis in the heart of the city.
